heroText: My name is Vasilis Smyris. I am a full-stack software developer from Greece, with a passion for efficient, scalable and user-friendly software.
aboutSummaryText:
Hello, I am Vasilis Smyris, a full-stack software developer based in Athens, Greece. I hold a BSc in Computer Science from the University of Piraeus and have recently embarked on my career in software development. Over the years, I have gained extensive experience in various programming languages, software development frameworks, and other technologies, both through my academic studies and personal projects. I possess a solid theoretical understanding of the principles of programming and a deep appreciation for the design of efficient, scalable and user-friendly software and the authoring of clean, reusable and maintainable code. My skillset includes front-end and back-end development, as well as a keen understanding of the infrastructure, in software and hardware, required to deploy complex applications. I specialize in the .NET Framework and the C# programming language, with a portfolio of desktop and web applications built using the plethora of the framework's project types.In addition, I have extensive experience with Python, which I use primarily for prototyping and exploring complex scientific topics. Recently, I have been expanding my horizons by delving into low-level problem-solving with C++, game development, and electronics.
    The most definitive culmination of the knowledge and skills I have gathered through the years, has been my university thesis, which touches upon smart home applications. The application developed for this project consists of a web server that works as the smart-home hub, which serves the users with a UI through web browser and facilitates the communication between them and the various smart devices in the network, developed using Blazor Webassembly, and a prototype smart RGB lamp device, built using a Raspberry Pi computer, Python and basic electronics knowledge. The highlight of the project is the creation of a protocol of communication between the devices and the server, which can facilitate the administration and control of the devices and the creation of UI pages for these purposes, independent of device type.
    I currently work as an IT Implementation Consultant at NCR Corporation, providing technical support for ATM solutions on a day-to-day basis. When I'm not working, I enjoy studying history and geography, editing photos and videos, working out, learning new languages, collecting and traveling. I'm always eager to collaborate on new projects, so please don't hesitate to get in touch.

projectsList.title: Smart Home University Thesis
projectsList.summary: This is my university thesis. The topic is smart home systems. The system of the project consist of a smart home hub web app and a protype RGB light smart device.
projectsList.technologies: Blazor Webassembly, C#, Python, Raspberry Pi, HTML5, CSS3, JS, PostgreSQL
points: Smart home application developed for my university thesis.
Application consists of a Blazor Webassembly web application, that serves as the smart home hub, and a prototype smart RGB light device.
Application is designed to be deployed on a local network and be used through the web browser of any device to control a smart device ecosystem.
Prototype smart device consists of a Raspberry Pi computer running a Python script containing the behavior of the device and a basic RGB lamp circuit connected to it.
The smart device script is designed to serve as a blueprint to create scripts for other types of devices.
Smart home hub is designed to allow for the control of a variable number of devices.
Smart home hub displays controls for the device based on the properties of the device and its supported property types.
Communication between the devices and the smart home hub is facilitated through the use of the WebSockets protocol.
Features, like user accounts and switching between a light and a dark theme, are included.

projectsList.title: ParKing
projectsList.summary: Parking Android app. The app enables users to easily view nearby parking facilities and relevant information, allowing them to quickly compare the options and find the one that best suits them.
points: Parking Android application made for a university project.
Users can view parking facilities around them on a map or in list format.
Users can quickly check and compare price, sercives and availability of parking facilities.
Application utilizes Google services and smartphone sensors like Google Maps, Google Firebase and GPS.

projectsList.title: Unity Scripting Demo
projectsList.summary: Small demo made to get familiar with Unity scripting. In the demo, players can control a first-person character and interact with various objects in the environment.
points: Small project made to get familiar with scripting in the Unity game engine.
Demo consists of a small environment with a first-person player controller and various interactions.

First-person controller has various standard functionalities, like moving and looking around, sprinting, changing stance(standing, crouching, prone) and interacting with various objects in the environment.
Interactions are facilitated through a generalized interaction framework that consists of showing an interaction prompt to the player and the ability to trigger the interaction.
Generalized interaction framework can be expanded upon, to facilitate the needs of each interaction.
Interactions implemented include teleporters, doors and elevators.
Interaction scripts can take a number of parameters that affect the behavior of the interaction.
